channel.title: Building a computer
channel.description:
I'm pretty much set on buying this computer but I want it to be double checked by people. Thanks for help.
Processor: Intel Core 2 Quad Q9650 3.0GHz LGA 775 95W Quad-Core Processor http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?item=N82E16819115130
Motherboard: Intel BOXDX48BT2 LGA 775 Intel X48 ATX Intel Motherboard - Retail http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813121338
Hard Drive: Western Digital Caviar Black WD1001FALS 1TB 7200 RPM SATA 3.0Gb/s 3.5" Internal Hard Drives - OEM http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136284
Power Supply: SILVERSTONE ELEMENT ST85EF 850W ATX12V / EPS12V SLI Ready CrossFire Ready 80 PLUS BRONZE Certified Active PFC Power Supply - Retail http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817256050
Sound Card: HT | OMEGA STRIKER 7.1 Channels PCI Interface Sound Card - Retail http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16829271001
RAM: OCZ Special Ops Urban Elite 4GB (2 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1600 (PC3 12800) Dual Channel Kit Desktop Memory Model ... - Retail http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820227324
DVD Burner: Sony Optiarc DVD Burner with LightScribe Black SATA Model AD-7241S-0B LightScribe Support - OEM http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16827118032
Case: NZXT Apollo Black SECC Steel Chassis ATX Mid Tower Computer Case - Retail http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811146025
Monitor: Acer X193W+BD Black 19" 5ms Widescreen LCD Monitor - Retail http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16824009127
Total: $1,217.91 I am looking for a heat sink and I have a nvidia 9800 gtx+ sitting in my bedroom so I think i have everything...

item.title: Building a computer
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

What are you using it for?

Read full topic

item.title: Building a computer
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

overkill power supply, overkill motherboard
do you really need the sound card?

Read full topic

item.title: Building a computer
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Speljohan:

I don’t notice any difference between budget-ram and expensive ones.

the CAS timing differences are so small you really wouldnt, im not sure about longevity of the cheaper ones though

Read full topic

item.title: Building a computer
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

I don’t notice any difference between budget-ram and expensive ones.

item.title: Building a computer
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:4, topic:290821”]My only problem is Expensive Motherboard is Expensive and that RAM manufacture is not that desirable.
Other than that its great.

Why are you looking for a heat sink? I thought you get one packaged with the CPU?[/quote]
OCZ make damn good RAM

Read full topic

item.description:

Other than that its great.
